intro: Valeriana mapirensis, commonly known as the Mapire valerian, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, often fragrant foliage. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
